skill.name: Project Architecture
skill.description: Overview of the project's tech stack, directory structure, and architectural patterns.
skill.summary: Overview of the project's tech stack, directory structure, and architectural patterns.
skill.author: AbdulSamad94

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only static markdown. No executable code, no network calls, no filesystem access beyond reading its own file, no command execution, and no environment variable access.

content.user_title: Explore project architecture and tech stack
content.value_statement: Understanding a project's architecture takes time and requires exploring multiple files. This skill provides instant access to tech stack details, directory structure, and architectural patterns for faster onboarding and decision making.
actual_capabilities: Retrieve tech stack information including frameworks, languages, and databases
Explain directory structure and key file locations
Describe architectural patterns and development workflows
Provide guidance on running development servers
Clarify hybrid app architecture combining Next.js and Docusaurus
limitations: Does not modify or create any project files
Cannot execute code or run commands in the project
Cannot generate new architectural diagrams or code
Limited to information contained in the skill documentation

use_cases.title: Onboard to project structure
use_cases.description: Quickly understand the tech stack, directory layout, and key patterns when joining a new project.

use_cases.title: Review architectural decisions
use_cases.description: Access documented patterns and structure to assess project organization and maintainability standards.

use_cases.title: Navigate codebase efficiently
use_cases.description: Find where components, utilities, and documentation live before making contributions.

prompt_templates.title: List tech stack
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the tech stack for this project?

prompt_templates.title: Explore directory structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the directory structure of this project.

prompt_templates.title: Find authentication setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Where are the authentication components and configuration located?

prompt_templates.title: Get development commands
prompt_templates.prompt: What commands are available for running the development servers?

output_examples.input: What is the tech stack for this project?
output: Styling: Tailwind CSS v4 and CSS Modules
Documentation: Docusaurus in the textbook directory
UI: Lucide React icons and custom components

best_practices: Use this skill early in the onboarding process to build a mental model of the project.
Combine with direct code exploration for complete understanding of patterns.
Reference documented patterns when proposing architectural changes.
anti_patterns: Assuming documented patterns are always current without verifying in code.
Making architectural changes without consulting the documented structure.
Relying solely on this skill without reading actual implementation files.

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It is designed for AI-assisted development workflows.

faq.question: What versions of Next.js are supported?
faq.answer: The skill documents Next.js 15 with App Router. Features may vary with different versions.

faq.question: How does this integrate with Docusaurus?
faq.answer: The project uses a hybrid architecture with Next.js for the main app and Docusaurus for documentation in the textbook directory.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads static documentation. It does not access, modify, or transmit any project data.

faq.question: Why is my project structure different?
faq.answer: This skill documents a specific project structure. Actual structures vary by project and may not match exactly.

faq.question: How is this different from reading source code?
faq.answer: This skill provides a curated overview. Reading source code gives complete detail but takes longer to understand the big picture.
